44 #include "statemachine.hpp"
45 #include "std_msgs/String.h"
46 
47 using namespace std;
48 
49 namespace Tapi
50 {
51 // Constructor/Destructor
52 StateMachine::StateMachine(ros::NodeHandle *nh) : nh(nh)
53 {
54  // Generate three demo states
55  tapi_lib::State state1;
56  state1.ID = "State1";
57  state1.Name = "State 1";
58  tapi_lib::Transition trans1;
59  trans1.Condition = "Wait 1 second";
60  trans1.ToID = "State2";
61  state1.Transitions.push_back(trans1);
62  states.push_back(state1);
63 
64  tapi_lib::State state2;
65  state2.ID = "State2";
66  state2.Name = "State 2";
67  tapi_lib::Transition trans2;
68  trans2.Condition = "Wait 1 second";
69  trans2.ToID = "State3";
70  state2.Transitions.push_back(trans2);
71  states.push_back(state2);
72 
73  tapi_lib::State state3;
74  state3.ID = "State3";
75  state3.Name = "State 3 with two transistions";
76  tapi_lib::Transition trans31;
77  trans31.Condition = "Wait 1 second";
78  trans31.ToID = "State1";
79  tapi_lib::Transition trans32;
80  trans32.Condition = "Never & Nothing";
81  trans32.ToID = "State2";
82  state3.Transitions.push_back(trans31);
83  state3.Transitions.push_back(trans32);
84  states.push_back(state3);
85 
86  // Create the current-state-publisher
87  tpub = new Tapi::Publisher(nh, "StateMachine Test");
88  pub = tpub->AddFeature<std_msgs::String>("Current State", 10);
89 
90  // Create the service to ask for the available states
91  tserv = new Tapi::ServiceServer(nh, "StateMachine Test");
92  tserv->AddFeature(ServiceServerOptionsForTapi(tapi_lib::GetStateMachine, &StateMachine::smCall), "StateMachine "
93  "States");
94 
95  // Start the thread which changes the current state once a second
96  changeStateThread = new thread(&StateMachine::changeState, this);
97 }
98 
99 StateMachine::~StateMachine()
100 {
101  delete tpub;
102  delete tserv;
103  changeStateThread->join();
104  delete changeStateThread;
105 }
106 
107 // Private member functions
108 
109 void StateMachine::changeState()
110 {
111  while (ros::ok())
112  {
113  // Wait a second, thand change the current state and publish it
114  this_thread::sleep_for(chrono::milliseconds(1000));
115  if (currentState == "State1")
116  currentState = "State2";
117  else if (currentState == "State2")
118  currentState = "State3";
119  else
120  currentState = "State1";
121  std_msgs::String msg;
122  msg.data = currentState;
123  pub->publish(msg);
124  }
125 }
126 
127 bool StateMachine::smCall(tapi_lib::GetStateMachine::Request &smReq, tapi_lib::GetStateMachine::Response &smResp)
128 {
129  if (smReq.Get)
130  {
131  smResp.States = states;
132  return true;
133  }
134  else
135  return false;
136 }
137 }
138 
148 int main(int argc, char **argv)
149 {
150  ros::init(argc, argv, "Tapi_StateMachine");
151  ros::NodeHandle nh;
152  Tapi::StateMachine sm(&nh);
153  ros::spin();
154 
155  return 0;
156 }
Tapi::StateMachine::smCall
bool smCall(tapi_lib::GetStateMachine::Request &smReq, tapi_lib::GetStateMachine::Response &smResp)
alled by a ros callback when a new call on its GetStateMachine service has been got. Responds with the available states
